title: L and T dwarfs in the Hyades and Ursa Major moving groups
abstract: We have used the moving cluster method to identify three L dwarfs and one T dwarf in the Ursa Major/Sirius moving group (age 400 Myr). Five L dwarfs and two T dwarfs are found to belong to the Hyades moving group (age 625 Myr). These L and T dwarfs define 400- and 625-Myr empirical isochrones, assuming that they have the same age. Moving group membership does not guarantee coevality
publisher: Oxford University Press (OUP), Royal Astronomical Society

Bannister, N. P.</dc:creator><dc:creator>

stars: kinematics</dc:subject><dc:subject>

open clusters and associations: individual: Ursa Major</dc:subject><dc:subject>
open clusters and associations: individual: Hyades</dc:subject><dc:subject>
galaxies: star clusters</dc:subject><dc:description>
We have used the moving cluster method to identify three L dwarfs and one T dwarf in the Ursa Major/Sirius moving group (age 400 Myr). Five L dwarfs and two T dwarfs are found to belong to the Hyades moving group (age 625 Myr). These L and T dwarfs define 400- and 625-Myr empirical isochrones, assuming that they have the same age. Moving group membership does not guarantee coevality.</dc:description><dc:date>
